Package pulse

Class Baseline

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.util.UpwardsNavigable
      • pulse.util.Group
        • pulse.util.Accessible
          • pulse.util.PropertyHolder
            • pulse.Baseline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Describable
    public class Baseline
extends PropertyHolder
    A Baseline is determined by its baselineType and two parameters: intercept and slope.

    The mathematical equivalent is the following expression: g(x) = intercept + slope * x. Baselines are always used in conjunction with respective HeatingCurve objects. The NumericPropertyKeyword associated with the intercept and slope parameters can be used as fitting variables for SearchTask, if included in the appropriate IndexedVector, the latter representing an objective function of the current search.

    See Also:
    HeatingCurve, SearchTask, IndexedVector

        public Baseline​(Baseline.BaselineType baselineType,
                double intercept,
                double slope)
        A constructor, which allows to specify all three parameters in one go.
        Parameters:
        baselineType - The functional type of the baseline.
        intercept - the intercept is the value of the Baseline's linear function at x = 0
        slope - the slope determines the inclination angle of the Baseline's graph.

      • fitTo

        public void fitTo​(ExperimentalData data,
                  double rangeMin,
                  double rangeMax)
        Calculates the intercept and/or slope parameters based on data.

        This will run a simple least-squares estimation of the parameters of this baseline using the specified data object. The estimation will only use the T(t) function values corresponding to rangeMin < t < rangeMax of the loaded data. If the getFittingStartIndex() method of the data object returns a zero value, this method will do nothing. If no data at rangeMin < t < rangeMax is available, the method will not change the intercept and slope values. If the BaselineType is CONSTANT, only the intercept value will be used as a fitting variable. Upon completing, the method will use the respective set methods of this class to update the intercept and slope values, triggering whatever events are associated with them.

        Parameters:
        data - the experimental curve, containing sufficient information for the fitting procedure.
        rangeMin - the lower bound for the fitting range
        rangeMax - the upper bound for the fitting range

      • parameters

        public double[] parameters()
        Creates and returns an array representing the parameters of this Baseline.

        Creates a double array with a size 2 with the following elements and in the following order: intercept and slope. This method is used when the baseline is flagged as belonging to the objective function of the corresponding Problem.

        Returns:
        an array of size two with the numeric parameters of the baseline
        See Also:
        Problem

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters​(double[] parameters)

        A method called by the Problem to assign intercept and/or slope parameters, which have been calculated when running the SearchTask.

        Parameters:
        parameters - an array of size 2, the elements of which are the intercept and the slope.
        See Also:
        Problem, SearchTask

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter​(int index,
                         double parameter)
        A method called by the Problem to assign the intercept and/or slope parameters, which have been calculated when running the associated SearchTask.
        Parameters:
        index - 0 for the intercept and 1 for the slope.
        parameter - the value of either intercept or slope to be assigned for this baseline
        See Also:
        Problem, SearchTask

      • fitTo

        public void fitTo​(ExperimentalData data)
        Calls fitTo using the default time range for the data: -Infinity < t < 0
        Parameters:
        data - the experimental data stretching to negative time values
        See Also:
        fitTo(pulse.input.ExperimentalData,double,double)

      • getBaselineType

        public Baseline.BaselineType getBaselineType()
        Represents the current baseline type.
        Returns:
        the baseline type

      • setBaselineType

        public void setBaselineType​(Baseline.BaselineType baselineType)
        Sets the baseline type.

        Searches the UpwardsNavigable queue for an ancestor assignable from the SearchTask class (or simply: searches for the instance of SearchTask owning this baseline). If the latter is found, it will call the fitTo(...) method, the argument of which is the ExperimentalData accessed by a getter method from the SearchTask.

        Parameters:
        baselineType - the new type of the baseline.

      • set

        public void set​(NumericPropertyKeyword type,
                NumericProperty property)
        Provides setter accessibility to the slope and intercept, treating them as instances of NumericProperty.

        Note this method does not have a built-in mechanism for checking whether NumericPropertyKeyword corresponds to a suitable value. However, the method only works if the type is set to either either BASELINE_INTERCEPT or BASELINE_SLOPE.

        Specified by:
        set in class Accessible
        Parameters:
        type - the keyword associated with the property
        property - the NumericProperty object with the NumericPropertyKeyword set to either BASELINE_INTERCEPT or BASELINE_SLOPE
